solution_line_template: He bought {num_dogs} dogs for ${cost_per_dog} each so they costs {num_dogs}*{cost_per_dog} = $<<{num_dogs}*{cost_per_dog}={total_dog_cost}>>{total_dog_cost}
He sells each of the {num_puppies} puppies for ${price_per_puppy} so he'll make {num_puppies}*{price_per_puppy} = $<<{num_puppies}*{price_per_puppy}={total_puppy_revenue}>>{total_puppy_revenue}

He made ${total_puppy_revenue} on the puppies but spent ${total_dog_cost} to buy the dogs so his total profit is {total_puppy_revenue}-{total_dog_cost} = $<<{total_puppy_revenue}-{total_dog_cost}={total_profit}>>{total_profit}
